channel.title: Issue tracker for CPub?
channel.description:
Ohay, I'm wondering about an issue tracker for CPub, since I'm bumping into an install issue and cannot find an issue tracker in the repository.
``` mix ecto.setup
18:09:56.469 [error] GenServer #PID<0.251.0> terminating ** (Postgrex.Error) FATAL 28P01 (invalid_password) password authentication failed for user "postgres" (db_connection 2.1.1) lib/db_connection/connection.ex:87: DBConnection.Connection.connect/2 (connection 1.0.4) lib/connection.ex:622: Connection.enter_connect/5 (stdlib 3.12.1) proc_lib.erl:249: :proc_lib.init_p_do_apply/3 Last message: nil State: Postgrex.Protocol ** (Mix) The database for CPub.Repo couldn't be created: killed ```
Since I'm on Debian, peer authentication is used by default.

item.title: Issue tracker for CPub?
item.dc:creator: pukkamustard
item.description:
I just enabled the issue tracker on GitLab: https://gitlab.com/openengiadina/cpub/-/issues

Seems to be a issue with the mix ecto.create task with peer authentication. Unfortunately, I think the solution is to change the PostgreSQL config to allow password authentication from localhost. See also this issue on the Pleroma issue tracker: https://git.pleroma.social/pleroma/pleroma/issues/232.
